required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Analgesic Efficacy and Occurrence of Emesis Among Different Background Infusion and Bolus Administration Regimens of Fentanyl Based Intravenous Patient-controlled Analgesia in Patients After Laparoscopic Assisted Gastrectomy - a Randomized Blind Study -

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

brief_summary.textblock: Fentanyl based intravenous patient controlled analgesia(PCA)is popular method for postoperative pain control, but information regarding optimal dose of fentanyl in IV PCA is currently lacking. We thus determine appropriate dose of fentanyl (bolus dose and background infusion rate) for effective pain control with minimal side effects such as nausea and vomiting

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pain socre after surgery 1) within 30min-6hrs, 2) within 6-24hrs, 3) within 24hrs-48hrs
primary_outcome.description: Pain score after surgery within 48hrs after laparoscopic gastrectomy

clinical_study.condition: The Patients With Gastric Cancer Who Are Scheduled to Receive Laparoscopy Assisted Gastrectomy

intervention.intervention_name: B0 group: bolus 0.6mcg/kg without background infusion
intervention.other_name: Fentanyl based intraveonus patient controlled analgesia

intervention.intervention_name: BL group: bolus 0.4mcg/kg with background infusion rate 0.2mcg/kg/hr
intervention.other_name: Fentanyl based intraveonus patient controlled analgesia

intervention.intervention_name: BH group: bolus 0.2mcg/kg with background infusion rate 0.4mcg/kg/hr
intervention.other_name: Fentanyl based intraveonus patient controlled analgesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 20 and 70
- ASA class I and II
- Gastric cancer patients who are scheduled to receive laparoscopic gastrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular disease(uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina, congestive heart failure, etc.)
- Renal failure
- Liver failure
- Chronic drug or alcohol abuser
- Anti-cancer chemotherapy
- Chronic opioid use
- Use of antiemetics within 24hrs for nausea and vomiting

facility.name: Severance Hospital, Yonsei University Health System

clinical_study.keyword: IntravenousPCA, fentanyl, postoperative pain, laparoscopic gastrectomy
